alert.note: Alert for Defiance; Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 2:41PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Steuben, northern Allen, southeastern Noble, northeastern Whitley, De Kalb, northwestern Defiance and southwestern Williams Counties through 315 PM EST... At 240 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Churubusco, or 10 miles east of Tri-lakes, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Huntertown and Avilla around 250 PM EST. Garrett around 255 PM EST. Auburn around 300 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Waterloo, St. Joe, Hicksville, Butler, Edgerton and Edgerton In Williams County. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 317 and 336. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for northeastern Indiana.
